content:
You're welcome! I'm excited to hear that you're going to start filling out your spreadsheet and analyzing your film festival experience. Adding columns for festival, genre, and rating will definitely help you identify patterns and trends in your viewing habits.

Remember to be patient and have fun with the process. It might take some time to fill out your spreadsheet, especially if you've seen a lot of films recently. But the insights you'll gain will be well worth the effort.

As you start analyzing your data, you might want to ask yourself additional questions, such as:

* Are there any specific festivals that tend to feature films that resonate with me?
* Are there certain genres or themes that I'm more drawn to during festivals?
* Do I tend to rate films higher or lower during festivals compared to non-festival screenings?
* Are there any directors or cinematographers that I've seen multiple times during festivals?

By asking these questions and examining your data, you'll gain a deeper understanding of your cinematic tastes and preferences. You might even discover new directors, genres, or themes that you hadn't considered before.

If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask. I'm always here to help. Happy spreadsheeting and film analyzing!
